The thieves appear to have carefully selected some of the most valuable objects while ignoring less important artefacts. They are not something you would come and randomly find, an Egyptologist at Cairo's American University, Salima Ikram Said Salima Ikram , told Reuters. Restoration work has already started at the museum to repair the damage by looters. Zahi Hawass said that 70 pieces were damaged.
